meanings.definition: Relating to knowledge or the study of knowledge.
meanings.sent1: The epistemic research paper discussed various theories of learning.
meanings.sent2: Her epistemic approach to problem-solving involved gathering evidence before making a decision.
meanings.sent3: The epistemic detective solved the case by carefully examining all the clues.
meanings.sent4: In the epistemic realm of academia, ideas are constantly being challenged and refined.
meanings.sent5: The epistemic nature of science encourages curiosity and exploration.

meanings.definition: Involving knowledge or the process of knowing.
meanings.sent1: The epistemic nature of the puzzle required logical thinking to solve.
meanings.sent2: His epistemic curiosity led him to ask insightful questions during the lecture.
meanings.sent3: The epistemic cat seemed to ponder the mysteries of the universe while staring out the window.
meanings.sent4: Her epistemic intuition guided her to the correct answer without any prior information.
meanings.sent5: The epistemic journey of discovery opened up new possibilities for understanding the world.
